Drug.Summary: ...dependent RNA polymerase (RDRP) inhibitors, for the potential treatment of measles virus infection [1283279], [1276737], [1276728]. In February 2012, the program was listed as...1276737].By April 2007, the most potent compound had acted as a target-specific measles virus replication inhibitor, and had desirable drug-like properties. The compound was highly active against multiple primary isolates of diverse measles virus genotypes. Mechanistic characterization on a subinfection level showed...

Drug.@name: ESP (multiple sclerosis/measles virus infection), Biomolecular Pharma
Drug.Summary: As no development has been reported for some time, this program is assumed to be discontinued.Biomolecular Pharma was developing ESP, an analog of the active metabolite of azathioprine, for the potential treatment of measles virus infection, believed by the company to be the cause of multiple sclerosis [1071082], [1218244]. By January 2010, a pilot study had been conducted [1071082]; in August 2011, development was ongoing [1218235].By January 2010, a pilot study had been conducted with seven...

Drug.@name: measles vaccine, Sinovac Dalian
Drug.Summary: Sinovac Dalian is investigating live attenuated vaccine for the potential prevention of measles virus infection. In May 2011, development was ongoing [1201231].In May 2010, Sinovac Dalian planned to commercialise a combination measles, mumps and rubella vaccine MMR that would be eligible for a government purchasing program, following approval of the mumps vaccine [1096130].

Drug.@name: measles vaccine (inhaled dry powder/CAN-BD), Aktiv-Dry
Drug.Summary: ...Nebulization with a Bubble Dryer (CAN-BD) technology, for the potential prevention of measles virus infection [789191], [789238], [1262652]. In March 2012, a phase I trial began. In September...CHI's Eighth Annual PepTalk Conference in San Diego, CA. Using the Edmonston-Zagreb measles strain, the immune response elicited in an animal model when the vaccine was stabilized...2005, the company was awarded $19.5 million by the NIH to support development of the measles vaccine [789191].

Drug.CompanyOriginator: State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR
Drug.@name: measles vaccine, NPO Vector
Drug.Summary: NPO Vector's (now SRC VB Vector) vaccine to prevent measles virus infection had been launched in Russia as of 2000 [359687], [360889]; it was awaiting registration in Russia in May 1996 [212606].

CompaniesPrimary.Company: State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR

Drug.@name: M-M-RvaxPRO
Drug.Summary: Sanofi Pasteur has developed and launched a triple live-attenuated vaccine (M-M-RvaxPRO) for measles, mumps and rubella. The vaccine is indicated for simultaneous vaccination against measles, mumps, and rubella in individuals from 12 months of age and in indivduals between 9 and 12 months of age under special circumstances [1515675]. In May 2006, M-M-RvaxPRO was approved in the EU and presumed the be launched shortly afterwards [1515679].In June 2004, Sanofi Pasteur filed an MAA with the EMA through...

Drug.CompanyOriginator: Beijing Tiantan Biological Products Co Ltd
Drug.@name: measles/mumps/rubella/varicella vaccine (live-attenuated), Beijing Tiantan Biological Products
Drug.Summary: Beijing Tiantan Biological Products is investigating a live-attenuated combined vaccine for the potential prevention of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella. In November 2013, a clinical trial application was filed in China [1495541], [1511680].In November 2013, the company intended to develop this vaccine as a class 7 preventive biologic in China [1495541].

CompaniesPrimary.Company: Beijing Tiantan Biological Products Co Ltd

Drug.CompanyOriginator: Guizhou Taibang Biological Products Co Ltd
Drug.@name: human immunoglobulin (intramuscular, measles/hepatitis virus infection), Guizhou Taibang Biological Products
Drug.Summary: Guizhou Taibang Biological Products (formerly Guiyang Qianfeng Biological Products) has developed and launched an intramuscular plasma-derived human immunoglobulin for the prevention of measles and infectious hepatitis. It was assumed that launch took place in China shortly after its approval there in 2000 [1474650], [1477604].

CompaniesPrimary.Company: Guizhou Taibang Biological Products Co Ltd

Drug.CompanyOriginator: Wuhan Institute of Biological Products Co Ltd
Drug.@name: measles/Japanese encephalitis vaccine (live attenuated), Wuhan Institute of Biological Products
Drug.Summary: Wuhan Institute of Biological Products is investigating a combined live attenuated vaccine for the potential prevention for measles and Japanese encephalitis virus infection. In February 2012, an application for clinical trials was submitted to China SFDA. In November 2012, the application was rejected [1473364], [1473367].

CompaniesPrimary.Company: Wuhan Institute of Biological Products Co Ltd

Drug.@name: measles/mumps/rubella vaccine, Dalian Aleph Biomedical
Drug.Summary: Dalian Aleph Biomedical is investigating a triple vaccine, for the potential prevention of measles, mumps, and rubella. In June 2013, the vaccine was listed as being under development on the company's website pipeline [1438975].

Drug.@name: human immunoglobulin (intramuscular, measles/hepatitis virus infection), Banghe Pharmaceutical
Drug.Summary: Banghe Pharmaceutical has developed and launched an intramuscular plasma-derived human immunoglobulin for the prevention of measles and infectious hepatitis, and for use in combination with antibiotics for the treatment of severe bacterial or viral infections. It was assumed that launch took place in China shortly after its approval there in 2002 [1424541], [1424500].

Drug.CompanyOriginator: Guangdong Weilun Biological Products Co Ltd
Drug.@name: human immunoglobulin (intramuscular, measles/hepatitis virus infection), Guangdong Weilun Biological Products
Drug.Summary: Guangdong Weilun Biological Products has developed and launched an intramuscular plasma-derived human immunoglobulin for the prevention of measles and infectious hepatitis, and for use in combination with antibiotics for the treatment of severe bacterial or viral infections. It was assumed that launch took place in China shortly after its approval there in 2000 [1411223], [1411222].

CompaniesPrimary.Company: Guangdong Weilun Biological Products Co Ltd

Drug.CompanyOriginator: Shenzhen Weiwu Guangming Biological Products Co Ltd
Drug.@name: human immunoglobulin (intramuscular, measles/hepatitis virus infection), Shenzhen Weiwu Guangming Biological Products
Drug.Summary: Shenzhen Weiwu Guangming Biological Products has developed and launched an intramuscular plasma-derived human immunoglobulin for the prevention of measles and infectious hepatitis, and for use in combination with antibiotics for the treatment of severe bacterial or viral infections. It was assumed that launch took place in China shortly after its approval there in 1999 [1410664], [1409381].

CompaniesPrimary.Company: Shenzhen Weiwu Guangming Biological Products Co Ltd

Drug.CompanyOriginator: Sichuan Yuanda Shuyang Pharmaceutical Co Ltd
Drug.@name: human immunoglobulin (intramuscular, measles/hepatitis virus infection), Sichuan Yuanda Shuyang Pharmaceutical
Drug.Summary: Sichuan Yuanda Shuyang Pharmaceutical has developed and launched an intramuscular plasma-derived human immunoglobulin for the prevention of measles and hepatitis virus infection. It was assumed that launch took place in China shortly after its approval there in 1998 [1405799], [1407050].

CompaniesPrimary.Company: Sichuan Yuanda Shuyang Pharmaceutical Co Ltd

Drug.@name: Trivivac
Drug.Summary: Sevapharma is developing Trivivac for the potential prevention of measles, mumps and rubella (MMR). In September 2012, a phase II/III trial was initiated in Thailand. In April 2014, the trial was ongoing [1382434].In September 2012, an open-label, single-group-assignment, phase II/III trial (NCT01763268; Trivivac2012) was initiated in healthy infants aged 9 to 14 months (n = 200). At that time, the study was expected to be completed in August 2015 [1382434].

Drug.@name: measles/Japanese encephalitis conjugate attenuated vaccine, Chengdu Institute of Biological Products
Drug.Summary: Chengdu Institute of Biological Products is investigating a live attenuated measles and Japanese encephalitis conjugate vaccine for the potential prevention for measles and JEV infection. In November 2011, an IND application of the drug was accepted by the SFDA; in November 2012, the application was rejected [1384044], [1385139].

Drug.@name: human immunoglobulin (intramuscular, measles/hepatitis virus infection), Hebei Da'an Pharmaceutical
Drug.Summary: Hebei Da'an Pharmaceutical has developed and launched an intramuscular plasma-derived human immunoglobulin for the prevention of measles and hepatitis virus infection. In 2006, the product was approved by the SFDA and was assumed to be launched in China shortly after. However, by August 2012, the company had stopped manufacturing this product because of a modification to the manufacturing...

Drug.@name: measles/rubella vaccine (subcutaneous, live), Beijing Minhai Biotechnology
Drug.Summary: Beijing Minhai Biotechnology has developed a combination vaccine consisting of live measles and rubella viruses, for the sc prevention of measles and rubella virus infections. In November 2011, an NDA was filed with the SFDA; in October 2012, the vaccine was approved in China [1337701], [1343776].

Drug.CompanyOriginator: Shanxi Kangbao Biological Products Co Ltd
Drug.@name: human immunoglobulin (im, hepatitis, measles), Shanxi Kangbao Biological Products
Drug.Summary: Shanxi Kangbao Biological Products has developed and launched an intramuscular plasma-derived human immunoglobulin for the prevention of hepatitis and measles. It can be used as an adjunct to antibiotics to increase efficacy against serious infections caused by bacteria or virus. The product was assumed to be launched in China shortly after its approval there in 1998 [1336339], [1336363].

CompaniesPrimary.Company: Shanxi Kangbao Biological Products Co Ltd

Drug.@name: measles vaccine, BioNet-Asia
Drug.Summary: BioNet-Asia, under license from an unspecified manufacturer, has launched an sc vaccine for the prevention of measles. By August 2011, the vaccine was available in Thailand [1218321].
